title: Coroner: 4 dead in killings in south Georgia town
description: A coroner says four people have been killed in the south Georgia city of Moultrie, including a fast food worker and two relatives of a gunman who took his own life

title: COVID dropped to 4th leading cause of death in US last year
description: U.S. deaths fell last year, and COVID-19 dropped to the No. 4 cause

title: Escaped Virginia inmate tied to sheriff's murder arrested in Mexico: FBI
description: One of the two inmates who escaped a Virginia jail has been arrested in Mexico following a dayslong manhunt, according to the FBI.

title: After win, Ed Sheeran slams 'baseless' and 'dangerous' copyright case
description: Ed Sheeran spoke out against what he called "dangerous" copyright claims after defeating a lawsuit that alleged he copied Marvin Gaye's "Let's Get It On."

title: 2 dead in home shooting, including 8-year-old boy; suspect fatally shot by police
description: Two people -- including an 8-year-old boy -- were killed in a home shooting in Newark, New Jersey, on Wednesday. The suspect was also fatally shot by police.

title: Biden issues order setting path for sanctions in Sudan
description: President Joe Biden has signed an executive order setting the path to sanction individuals involved in the recent violence in Sudan that’s left hundreds dead and thrown the African nation into chaos

title: US ambassador visits American Paul Whelan at Russian prison
description: The U.S. ambassador to Russia has visited Michigan corporate security executive Paul Whelan in a remote Russian prison

title: Ex-NBA star Shawn Kemp pleads not guilty to shooting charge
description: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp pleaded not guilty Thursday to an assault charge after prosecutors accused him of shooting at a man while attempting to retrieve a stolen cell phone

title: 9 dolphins saved after swimming close to shore
description: International Fund for Animal Welfare rescued up to nine dolphins in various spots off the coast of Massachusetts after they swam too close to shore.

title: Person of interest detained in deadly UC Davis stabbings: Police
description: A person of interest has been detained in connection with three stabbings -- two of which killed a college senior and a homeless man -- in Davis, California.

title: Jury reaches verdict in Ed Sheeran copyright infringement case
description: A jury has reached a verdict in a copyright infringement case involving Ed Sheeran's "Thinking Out Loud" and Marvin Gaye's "Let's Get It On."

title: WATCH:  2 people and dog rescued from sinking boat in Georgia
description: Two people and a dog were rescued from a sinking boat off the coast of Georgia. The pair and dog Reggie were “in good spirits,” the U.S. Coast Guard said.

title: Iowa State football player accused of raping injured woman
description: An Iowa State football player has been arrested on charges alleging that he raped a woman in his home while she lay immobile after he shoved her so hard it fractured her spine

title: Billionaire Harlan Crow paid tuition for Justice Thomas' grandnephew, report says
description: ProPublica reported Thursday the tuition payments may have exceeded $150,000.

title: Proud Boys leader convicted of Jan. 6 seditious conspiracy
description: The trial has been going on since December.

title: 2 states investigating NFL over allegations of workplace discrimination, hostility
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James and California Attorney General Rob Bonta are investigating the NFL over allegations of workplace discrimination and hostility.

title: WATCH:  Man rushes to save baby in runaway stroller
description: Security video shows a good Samaritan jump into action as the stroller was rolling toward heavy traffic.

title: Investor buys Caribbean isles once owned by Jeffrey Epstein
description: A U.S. investor has bought two Caribbean islands that were once owned by disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein and where authorities allege many of his crimes took place

title: US claims for unemployment aid jump, but remain low
description: The number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits jumped last week but remain low overall, even as the Federal Reserve has furiously raised interest rates to beat down inflation and cool the labor market

title: WHO fires scientist who led COVID search over sex misconduct
description: The World Health Organization says it has fired the scientist who led a high-profile delegation from the U.N. health agency to China two years ago to jointly look into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic, citing sexual misconduct

title: Shell posts $9.6 billion profit even as energy prices slide
description: Global energy giant Shell says it earned nearly $10 billion in the first quarter, becoming the latest fossil fuel company to post strong financial results despite sliding oil and gas prices

title: 1 unaccounted for following chemical explosion in Newburyport, Massachusetts
description: Four workers were found, but one remains unaccounted for following a chemical explosion at an industrial park in Newburyport, Massachusetts, early Thursday.

title: 300 minors, including 10-year-olds, found working at 3 McDonald's franchisees: DOL
description: The U.S. Department of Labor fined three McDonald's franchisees after it was revealed that children were working there in violation of federal labor law.

title: Trump lawsuit against New York Times over 2018 series tossed
description: Former President Donald Trump’s lawsuit against The New York Times over a 2018 investigative series into his family’s wealth and tax practices was dismissed by a state judge

title: Cop found dead at home killed wife in murder-suicide: Officials
description: A North Carolina police officer shot and killed his wife before turning the gun on himself, state authorities updated Wednesday amid an investigation into their deaths.

title: Man shocked with Taser files lawsuit against Colorado police
description: According to attorneys, Kenneth Espinoza was shocked 35 times in the face and body, but the sheriff's department disagrees, saying that he was only shocked once.
